title: A Talk About Moms and Babies in America
summary: In a podcast called 'Settle In,' Amna Nawaz talks to Irin Carmon, a writer who wrote a book about five women in America. These women are pregnant and want to have their babies, but they face many problems. The book shows how laws and doctors in America sometimes make it hard for pregnant women to get the care they need. It tells stories from before, during, and after pregnancy. The women live in New York and Alabama, and they all have different challenges. The podcast helps people understand what it's like to be pregnant in America today. It's important to learn about these stories so we can help make things better for moms and babies.

background_read: This article is about a podcast where a journalist talks about her book on pregnancy in America. It's for kids aged 8-10 to learn about how some women face challenges when they are pregnant. The book tells real stories to help people see why it's important to support moms and babies with good care and fair laws. It's a simple way to understand big topics like health and rules in society.
Article_Structure: WHO: Amna Nawaz and Irin Carmon, a journalist and author.
WHAT: A podcast discussion about a book on pregnant women in America facing challenges with care and laws.
WHERE: The podcast is online, and the book stories are set in New York and Alabama.
WHY: To share stories that help people understand and improve conditions for pregnant women and babies in America.

perspectives.description: The article shows how sharing personal stories can raise awareness and encourage help for pregnant women.
